6500.name: The Path To The Dwarven Village
6500.description:
The way continues down a path that leads to the dwarven village. Above
you, Visible is the Turning Point, and to the north the path continues
toward the mountains. The open sky stretches overhead. Tall grass sways
in a gentle breeze.

up.description: You can see the city of Midgaard.

6501.name: The Path At The Base Of The Mountain
6501.description:
Now you are at the bottom of a rugged mountain. The forest around is
very dense, and it seems very dark to the north. The terrain rolls and
dips around. The view stretches for miles in every direction.

north.description: The path coninues up the mountain.

south.description: The path heads toward the main city of Midgaard.

6502.name: The Path At The Middle Of The Mountain
6502.description:
Standing on the middle of the mountain, you can easily see the city to
the south, and the top of the mountain is very near to the north. Snow
clings to shadowed crevices. The wind howls around exposed peaks.

north.description: The top of the mountain is easily seen from here.

south.description: The base of the mountain is near.

6503.name: The Top Of The Mountain
6503.description:
The area is now on the top of the mountain. To the south you see a path
leading down the mountain. To the east and west you see entrances to
what seems like mines. The terrain rolls and dips around. Rocks jut from
the grassy slopes.

east.description: An entrance to the mountain which seems to lead underground.

south.description: The path leads down the mountain to the main city of Midgaard.

west.description: There is an entrance to the mountain.

6504.name: The Narrow Path
6504.description:
This is a narrow path leading to the Dwarven Kingdom. It looks less
travelled than the others, and it is very creepy. The path opens up to
the south, and continues to the north. The ceiling hangs low overhead.
The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch.

6505.name: The Entrance To The Mountain
6505.description:
Here is an entrance to the mountain. The door looks very well built, and
you can hear noise coming from within. The air is fresh and clean.
Wildflowers dot the landscape.

6506.name: A Bend In The Narrow Path
6506.description:
This is a narrow path that bends to the east here. The trees hang over
the path, and it is very overgrown. The narrow path continues to the
south and to the east. The ceiling hangs low overhead. The air is still
and musty.

6507.name: The Narrow Path
6507.description:
This path is very narrow, and it continues to the north and west.
Shadows gather in the corners. Dust motes drift in the stale air. The
air is stale and the walls close. Shadows pool in the corners,
undisturbed.

6508.name: The Narrow North-South Path
6508.description:
This path leads to the north and south. To the north Visible is a door,
and to the south the path continues. Dust motes drift in the stale air.
The air is still and musty.

6509.name: The Door To The Kingdom
6509.description:
Here the path turns to the west. Visible is a door ahead, and the path
continues to the west and south. Shadows gather in the corners. The
ceiling hangs low overhead.

6510.name: On The Path To The Castle
6510.description:
The area is a path that will eventually lead to the castle. It continues
north to the castle, and there is a door in the southern wall. Shadows
gather in the corners. Dust motes drift in the stale air.

6511.name: Still On The Path To The Castle
6511.description:
The area is still on the path to the castle, or back to the Dwarven
village, whichever way you wish to go. The path continues to the north
and south. The ceiling hangs low overhead. Shadows gather in the
corners.

6512.name: The Door To The Castle
6512.description:
Here there is a door to the castle to the east. The castle is elegantly
designed, and looks much like a roll of toilet paper standing on its
end. There is a sign which says:
****************************************** * WELCOME TO THE CASTLE OF
STRANGELOVE * * Here, celibacy is uninvited *
****************************************** Shadows gather in the
corners. The air is still and musty.

6513.name: Inside The Entrance
6513.description:
Everything here is covered in soot and very grimy. The path continues to
the east and north, and there is a door to the west. The walls are
rough-hewn and cold to the touch. The ceiling hangs low overhead.

north.description: The little underground path continues to the north.

east.description: The path leads outside the entrance.

west.description: This looks like an entrance to some type of store room.

6514.name: The Path
6514.description:
The area is a path in the dwarven village which leads north to the shops
and south to the corner of the area. The walls are rough-hewn and cold
to the touch. Dust motes drift in the stale air.

6515.name: A Turn In The Road
6515.description:
The area is a path that leads to the Hide & Tooth shop to the west, and
the path continues to the south. Dust motes drift in the stale air. The
walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch.

west.description: The Hide & Tooth shop can be seen to the west.

6516.name: The Hide & Tooth Shop
6516.description:
This is the Hide & Tooth shop. Here you may buy the finest in Dwarven
weapons and armors. The path continues to the north and east. The
ceiling hangs low overhead. Shadows gather in the corners.

6517.name: The Path To The North Of The Shop
6517.description:
The area is a path to the north of the Hide & Tooth shop. The path
continues to the north, and there is Granite Head's bakery to the west.
The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch. The air is still and
musty.

6518.name: North Of The Shops
6518.description:
Here the path bends to the east towards the barracks. To the south you
can see the shops. Dust motes drift in the stale air. The walls are
rough-hewn and cold to the touch.

6519.name: A Path By The Hospital
6519.description:
Here the path passes by the Hospital to the north. It continues to the
east to the barracks, and to the west. Shadows gather in the corners.
The ceiling hangs low overhead.

6520.name: A Path Next To The Barracks
6520.description:
Here the path continues west, and east to the barracks. The ceiling
hangs low overhead. The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch. The
air is stale and the walls close. Shadows pool in the corners,
undisturbed.

6521.name: The Entrance To The Barracks
6521.description:
Here there is an entrance to the barracks to the south, and the path
continues to the west. The air is still and musty. The walls are rough-
hewn and cold to the touch.

6522.name: A Guard House
6522.description:
This is the guard house to the west of the entrance to the castle. There
are nudie posters covering the walls. The air is still and musty.
Shadows gather in the corners.

6523.name: The First Barrack Room
6523.description:
Here is the first of two main rooms of barracks. The barracks continue
to the south, and you can leave the room to the north. The walls are
rough-hewn and cold to the touch. The air is still and musty.

6524.name: The Back Of The Barracks
6524.description:
Here is the back of the dwarven barracks. There are rows of beds here,
and there is a stench that is unbearable. Shadows gather in the corners.
The ceiling hangs low overhead.

6525.name: Inside Of Castle Strangelove
6525.description:
The area is just inside the castle. It is very tubular in shape, and it
is very featureless. There is a set of stairs that lead up, and the door
leads out of the castle to the west. The ceiling hangs low overhead. The
walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch.

6526.name: A Store Room
6526.description:
There is a layer of dust on the floor at least 3 inches thick! It is
probable that not many people have been in here for many months. Dust
motes drift in the stale air. The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the
touch.

east.description: A lighted area that looks like a well worn path.

down.description: After blowing all the dust off the floor, you notice a trapdoor!

6527.name: The Wine Cellar
6527.description:
This room smells like wine, and you can only assume it used to be a wine
cellar at one time. Dust motes drift in the stale air. The walls are
rough-hewn and cold to the touch.

6528.name: On The Stairs In Castle Strangelove
6528.description:
Stone stairs spiral upward through Castle Strangelove's interior. The
steps are worn smooth by countless boots over the years, and arrow slits
in the thick walls provide narrow views of the surrounding kingdom. The
walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch. The air is still and musty.

6529.name: On The Stairs
6529.description:
The area is still circling around on the stairs. The area is starting to
get dizzy from going around and around and around and around and around.
The stairs continue up and down. The ceiling hangs low overhead. The
walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch.

6530.name: At The Top Of The Stairs
6530.description:
This is the top of the stairs in the castle. There is an exit to the
east, and the stairs lead down. Shadows gather in the corners. The
ceiling hangs low overhead.

6531.name: The Queen's Waiting Room
6531.description:
This is the Queen's waiting room. Here the men literally 'wait' for the
queen. You've heard that the queen really likes to get to 'know' her
people, in the biblical sense. The Queen's bedroom is to the north, and
Visible is stairs to the west. Shadows gather in the corners. The air is
still and musty.

6532.name: The Queen's Bedroom
6532.description:
This is the Queen's bedroom. The bed is all ruffled, and there is a
stack of dirty sheets piled in the corner. There is a ladder that leads
down, out of the castle, and you can leave the room to the south. There
is also a small wooden door to the west. There is a sign that says:
------------------------- | I'm busy right now, | | and don't know when
| | Ill be back, but if | | there is a key here | | take it and PLEASE,
| | try to get my birth | | control pills back! | | I've heard they can
| | be found somewhere, | | deep in the mines.. |
------------------------- The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the
touch. Dust motes drift in the stale air.

6533.name: The North Side Of Castle Strangelove
6533.description:
This area is the north side of Castle Strangelove. You notice that you
are no longer inside the mountain anymore either. Along the southern
horizon you see towering mountains. The only exit, however, is back up
the ladder into the Queen's Bedroom. The air is still and musty. The
walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch.

6534.name: The Hospital
6534.description:
This isside the Dwarven Hospital. It smells like rubbing alcohol, and
there is blood all over the walls. The air is still and musty. The walls
are rough-hewn and cold to the touch.

6535.name: Granite Head's Bakery
6535.description:
The aroma coming from this room is astonishing. You can almost taste the
pastries dissolving in your mouth. The air is still and musty. Dust
motes drift in the stale air.

6540.name: The Dark Path
6540.description:
This path is very well worn, and there is an entrance to the mines to
the east, while the path continues to the north and west. Shadows gather
in the corners. The ceiling hangs low overhead.

6541.name: The Mine Entrance
6541.description:
The little path here leads down toward the mines, while the worn path
continues to the west. The air is still and musty. Shadows gather in the
corners.

6542.name: At The Bottom Of The Mineshaft
6542.description:
This is the bottom of the mineshaft. The air here is very sooty, and it
is very hard to breath. The mineshaft leads up and east. The ceiling
hangs low overhead. The air is still and musty.

6543.name: On The Path Inside The Mine
6543.description:
The area is deep inside the mine, and you feel very uncomfortable. The
path continues to the east, and leads to the mineshaft to the west. The
air is still and musty. The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch.

6544.name: The Mine Crossroad
6544.description:
This is a crossroad in the mine. There is a door to the north, and the
path continues to the south, east, and west. The walls are rough- hewn
and cold to the touch. Dust motes drift in the stale air.

6545.name: The Coal Room
6545.description:
This isside the storage area for the raw materials that are found down
here. The room is very unsturdy as the supports are very rickety. Dust
motes drift in the stale air. The ceiling hangs low overhead.

6546.name: The Mine Maze
6546.description:
The entrance opens to the maze of the mines. To the east Visible is some
inscriptions, and you can exit to the south. The ceiling hangs low
overhead. The air is still and musty.

6547.name: At The Maze Inscription
6547.description:
This isside the maze, but not far enough in that you could get lost.
There is an enscription on the wall which says: 1 3 2 4 N W N S This
isn't too tough, so don't take it so rough. The walls are rough-hewn and
cold to the touch. The air is still and musty.

6548.name: The Maze
6548.description:
The maze twists and turns through carved stone passages. Each corridor
looks identical to the last, deliberately designed to confuse intruders.
The air is cool and still, and sound travels strangely through the
labyrinth. The air is still and musty. The walls are rough-hewn and cold
to the touch.

6549.name: The Maze
6549.description:
Identical stone walls press in from all sides in this section of the
maze. The passages split and rejoin in bewildering patterns, and you've
lost all sense of direction in this dwarven-crafted puzzle. The air is
still and musty. Shadows gather in the corners.

6550.name: The Maze
6550.description:
The maze continues its disorienting pattern of stone corridors and dead
ends. Every wall looks the same, every turn potentially leading you
deeper into the labyrinth or back to where you started. The walls are
rough-hewn and cold to the touch. The air is still and musty.

6551.name: The Mining Equipment Room
6551.description:
This is the storage room for equipment used by the Dwarven miners. It is
very small, and you can tell that not many miners actually use
equipment. Dust motes drift in the stale air. The ceiling hangs low
overhead.

6552.name: The End Of The Maze
6552.description:
You have solved the maze. You can tell by the last few moves that there
is no way that a dumb worker could have figured that out. It seems
pretty desolate here. To the south is a bleak room. To the north, you
see the maze. There is a sign above the south exit: THOSE WHO ENTER,
PLAN ON A TIMELY DEATH. (ESPECIALLY IF YOU'RE LOYAL TO THE QUEEN) The
walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch. Dust motes drift in the
stale air.

6553.name: The Mazekeeper's Room
6553.description:
The entrance opens to the Mazekeeper's room. There are pictures of the
Queen with darts thrown at it. Spraypainted on the wall are things like
'the queen shall suffer' and 'Catholics Rule'. The air is still and
musty. The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch.

6554.name: The Treasury
6554.description:
This room appears to be the Queen's Treasury. There is one exit, back to
the east. Vendors and pedestrians bustle past. The sounds of city life
echo around.

6500.name: guard
6500.description:
The guard looks very tough and mean.  He wears his beard long, and he
smells like he hasn't bathed in over a month.

6501.name: worker
6501.long_desc: A dwarven mining worker is here.
6501.description: He is very dirty, and looks extremely over-worked.

6502.name: wraith
6502.long_desc: A wraith is awaiting your first move here.

6503.name: storekeeper
6503.long_desc: The Hide & Tooth storekeeper is standing here, waiting patiently.
6503.description: The storekeeper is very rotund, but looks in excellent condition.

6504.name: baker
6504.long_desc: Granite Head, the baker, is waiting for a customer here.
6504.description: Granite Head is covered with flour and grains.

6505.name: lizard
6505.long_desc: A giant lizard is foraging for food along the cavern floor here.
6505.description:
This scaly creature looks like it is well adapted to its underground
habitat.  He looks very powerful.

6506.name: giant
6506.long_desc: A giant is wandering around the mountainside here.
6506.description:
The giant is about 18 feet tall, with arms of steel, and looks in
excellent physical condition.

6507.name: mineworker
6507.description: The mineworker is very tired, and very dirty, and he has bulging muscles.

6508.name: mineleader
6508.long_desc: A dwarven mine leader is here, supervising the work.
6508.description:
The mine leader is very big and very strong, though he must be fairly
bright also, to have gotten this job.

6509.name: doctor
6509.long_desc: The dwarven doctor is here, aiding the sick of his people.
6509.description: He is a very skilled healer, and extremely faithful to his god.

6510.name: peon
6510.long_desc: A dwarven peon is awaiting help here.

6514.name: guard
6514.long_desc: A barrack guard is here, lounging around while off duty.

6517.name: snake
6517.long_desc: There is a giant snake here.

6500.name: key
6500.room_desc: There is a key for the treasury lying here.

6501.name: gold
6501.room_desc: A large pile of treasure has been left here, it must be the Queen's.

6502.name: key
6502.room_desc: There is a key to the mines lying here.

6503.name: key
6503.room_desc: There is a bright golden key lying here.

6504.name: hammer
6504.room_desc: There is a dwarven hammer lying here.

6505.name: plate
6505.room_desc: There is dwarven plate mail lying here.

6506.name: stick
6506.room_desc: There is a long, black stick lying here.

6507.name: stick
6507.room_desc: There is a long, black stick here.

6508.name: club
6508.room_desc: There is a dwarven club lying here.

6509.name: axe
6509.room_desc: A two-handed dwarven axe is here.

6511.name: ring
6511.room_desc: A golden dwarven ring is lying here.

6512.name: gloves
6512.room_desc: A pair of thick dwarven gloves lay here.

6513.name: coal
6513.room_desc: There is a chunk of coal here.

6514.name: pick
6514.room_desc: There is a mining pick here.

6515.name: key
6515.room_desc: There is a deep green key lying here.

6516.name: key
6516.room_desc: Someone seems to have dropped an old key.

6519.name: iron oath sigil
6519.room_desc: An iron oath sigil lies here.
